alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 10:16PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette and Westmoreland. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding on Route 819 in Mount Pleasant. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Route 819 in Mount Pleasant is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Connellsville, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Youngwood, West Newton, New Stanton, Perryopolis, Everson, Smithton, Madison, Dawson, Hunker and Acme. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
